required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Adalimumab for the Induction of Clinical Remission in Japanese Subjects With Crohn's Disease
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-Center, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Study of Adalimumab for the Induction of Clinical Remission in Japanese Subjects With Crohn's Disease

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to demonstrate the efficacy and safety of adalimumab for the induction of clinical remission in Japanese subjects with Crohn's disease.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: The Number of Subjects With a Clinical Remission (Crohn's Disease Activity Index [CDAI] < 150) at Week 4
primary_outcome.description: CDAI is used to quantify the symptoms of patients with Crohn's Disease. A score below 150 indicates remission and a score above 450 indicates severe disease. Comparison of the number of subjects with a clinical remission (CDAI < 150) in the adalimumab 160 mg (Week 0)/ 80 mg (Week 2) and adalimumab 80 mg (Week 0)/ 40 mg (Week 2) groups at Week 4.

secondary_outcome.description: Number of subjects in each treatment group in clinical remission (CDAI < 150) in Full Analysis Set (FAS) using non-responder Imputation (NRI) at Week 2.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Response (CR-70 and CR-100) in Period A
secondary_outcome.description: The number of subjects in each treatment group with a clinical response 70 (CDAI decrease of >=70 compared to Baseline) and 100 (CDAI decrease of >=100 compared to Baseline) at Week 2 and Week 4.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Response (CR-70 and CR-100) in Period B
secondary_outcome.description: The Number of subjects in each treatment group with a CR-70 (CDAI decrease of >= 70 compared to Baseline) and 100 (CDAI decrease of >= 100 compared to Baseline) in subjects who were non-responders at Week 4 at Week 6 and Week 8.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Remission (CDAI <150) at Week 6 and Week 8
secondary_outcome.description: The number of subjects with clinical remission (CDAI < 150) in the subjects who were non-responders at Week 4 calculated with non-responder imputation (NRI) at Week 6 and Week 8

intervention.description: 160 mg at Week 0, 80 mg at Week 2
80 mg at Week 0, 40 mg at Week 2

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Crohn's Disease Activity Index (CDAI) score of >= 220 and <= 450
- If subjects have previously been administered infliximab, subjects who discontinued use due to a loss of response or intolerance to infliximab therapy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Ulcerative colitis or indeterminate colitis
- History of cancer, lymphoma, leukemia or lymphoproliferative disease, active tuberculosis (TB), or Human immunodeficiency virus (HIV)
- Body weight is below 30 kg
- Surgical bowel resections within the past 6 months
- Females who are pregnant or breast-feeding or considering becoming pregnant during the study

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects with moderate to severe Crohn's Disease (Crohn's Disease Activity Index [CDAI] >= 220 and <= 450) were enrolled into study. The period from the first dose of study drug to the evaluation at Week 4 is Period A. The period from the study drug injection at Week 4 to the evaluation at Week 8 is Period B.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: All subjects were evaluated at Week 4. If responders (CDAI decrease >= 70 points compared to Baseline), rolled over to a maintenance study. If non-responders (CDAI decrease of < 70 points compared to Baseline), continued in study and received: adalimumab 160/80 mg + 40/40 mg, or adalimumab 80/40 mg + 40/40 mg or placebo + adalimumab 160/80 mg.

group.title: Adalimumab 160 mg/80 mg
group.description: Adalimumab 160 mg at Week 0, 80 mg at Week 2

group.title: Adalimumab 80 mg/40 mg
group.description: Adalimumab 80 mg at Week 0, 40 mg at Week 2

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo at Week 0, placebo at Week 2

group.title: Adalimumab 40mg /40 mg
group.description: Non-responders continued after 4 weeks, Adalimumab 160 at Week 0, 80 mg at Week 2, 40 mg at Week 4, 40 mg at Week 6; Adalimumab 80 mg at Week 0, 40 mg at Week 2, 40 mg at Week 4, 40 mg at Week 6.

participants_list.participants: 23 rated as responders and 9 rated as non-responders in evaluation on Week 4.
20 rated as responders and 12 rated as non-responders in evaluation on Week 4.
7 rated as responders and 16 rated as non-responders in evaluation on Week 4.
Non-responders continued after 4 weeks, previous 16 placebo subjects allocated to 160/80 mg group.
Non-responders continued after 4 weeks, previous 80/40 mg subjects allocated to 40/40 mg group.
Non-responders continued after 4 weeks, previous placebo subjects allocated to 160/80 mg group.
Non-responders continued after 4 weeks, previous 160/80 and 80/40 subjects allocated to 40/40 group.

outcome.title: The Number of Subjects With a Clinical Remission (Crohn's Disease Activity Index [CDAI] < 150) at Week 4
outcome.description: CDAI is used to quantify the symptoms of patients with Crohn's Disease. A score below 150 indicates remission and a score above 450 indicates severe disease. Comparison of the number of subjects with a clinical remission (CDAI < 150) in the adalimumab 160 mg (Week 0)/ 80 mg (Week 2) and adalimumab 80 mg (Week 0)/ 40 mg (Week 2) groups at Week 4.
outcome.population: The primary analysis will be performed on the full analysis set (randomized subjects who received at least one dose of study drug) using the non-responder imputation for missing remission observations.

measure.title: The Number of Subjects With a Clinical Remission (Crohn's Disease Activity Index [CDAI] < 150) at Week 4
measure.description: CDAI is used to quantify the symptoms of patients with Crohn's Disease. A score below 150 indicates remission and a score above 450 indicates severe disease. Comparison of the number of subjects with a clinical remission (CDAI < 150) in the adalimumab 160 mg (Week 0)/ 80 mg (Week 2) and adalimumab 80 mg (Week 0)/ 40 mg (Week 2) groups at Week 4.
measure.population: The primary analysis will be performed on the full analysis set (randomized subjects who received at least one dose of study drug) using the non-responder imputation for missing remission observations.

outcome.title: Clinical Remission (CDAI < 150) at Week 2
outcome.description: Number of subjects in each treatment group in clinical remission (CDAI < 150) in Full Analysis Set (FAS) using non-responder Imputation (NRI) at Week 2.
outcome.population: Subjects with a clinical remission (CDAI <= 150) in the adalimumab 160 mg (Week 0/80 mg (Week 2) and adalimumab 80 mg (Week 0)/40 mg (Week 2) in full analysis set using Non-responder Imputation.

group.title: Adaliumab 160 mg/80 mg
group.description: Adalimumab 160 mg at Week 0, 80 mg at Week 2

group.title: Adalimumab 80 mg/40 mg
group.description: Adalimumab 80 mg at Week 0, 40 mg at Week 2

group.title: Placebo + 160/80 mg
group.description: Placebo at Week 0, placebo at Week 2

measure.title: Clinical Remission (CDAI < 150) at Week 2
measure.description: Number of subjects in each treatment group in clinical remission (CDAI < 150) in Full Analysis Set (FAS) using non-responder Imputation (NRI) at Week 2.
measure.population: Subjects with a clinical remission (CDAI <= 150) in the adalimumab 160 mg (Week 0/80 mg (Week 2) and adalimumab 80 mg (Week 0)/40 mg (Week 2) in full analysis set using Non-responder Imputation.

outcome.title: Clinical Response (CR-70 and CR-100) in Period A
outcome.description: The number of subjects in each treatment group with a clinical response 70 (CDAI decrease of >=70 compared to Baseline) and 100 (CDAI decrease of >=100 compared to Baseline) at Week 2 and Week 4.
outcome.population: The secondary efficacy analysis was performed using descriptive statistics in randomized subjects who received at least one dose of study drug (full analysis set) in the three treatment groups: Adalimumab 160 mg/80 mg, adalimumab 80mg/40 mg, and placebo.

group.title: Adaliumab 160 mg/80 mg
group.description: Adalimumab 160 mg at Week 0, 80 mg at Week 2

group.title: Adalimumab 80 mg/40 mg
group.description: Adalimumab 80 mg at Week 0, 40 mg at Week 2

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo at Week 0, placebo at Week 2,

measure.title: Clinical Response (CR-70 and CR-100) in Period A
measure.description: The number of subjects in each treatment group with a clinical response 70 (CDAI decrease of >=70 compared to Baseline) and 100 (CDAI decrease of >=100 compared to Baseline) at Week 2 and Week 4.
measure.population: The secondary efficacy analysis was performed using descriptive statistics in randomized subjects who received at least one dose of study drug (full analysis set) in the three treatment groups: Adalimumab 160 mg/80 mg, adalimumab 80mg/40 mg, and placebo.

outcome.title: Clinical Response (CR-70 and CR-100) in Period B
outcome.description: The Number of subjects in each treatment group with a CR-70 (CDAI decrease of >= 70 compared to Baseline) and 100 (CDAI decrease of >= 100 compared to Baseline) in subjects who were non-responders at Week 4 at Week 6 and Week 8.
outcome.population: Full analysis set - subjects rated as non-responders (did not attain CDAI reduction >= 70) in the evaluation of CR-70 and CR-100 at Week 4. For Week 6 and Week 8 descriptive statistics performed only for non-responders at Week 4 in the three treatment groups: adalimumab 160/80 mg + 40/40 mg, adalimumab 80/40 mg + 40/40 mg, and placebo + 160/80 mg.

group.title: Adaliumab 160 mg/80 mg + 40/40 mg
group.description: Adalimumab 160 mg at Week 0, 80 mg at Week 2, 40 mg at Week 4, and 40 mg at Week 6

group.title: Adalimumab 80 mg/40 mg + 40/40 mg
group.description: Adalimumab 80 mg at Week 0, 40 mg at Week 2, 40 mg at Week 4, and 40 mg at Week 6

group.title: Placebo + Adalimumab 160/80 mg
group.description: Placebo at Week 0, placebo at Week 2, adalimumab 160 mg at Week 4, and adalimumab 80 mg at Week 6

measure.title: Clinical Response (CR-70 and CR-100) in Period B
measure.description: The Number of subjects in each treatment group with a CR-70 (CDAI decrease of >= 70 compared to Baseline) and 100 (CDAI decrease of >= 100 compared to Baseline) in subjects who were non-responders at Week 4 at Week 6 and Week 8.
measure.population: Full analysis set - subjects rated as non-responders (did not attain CDAI reduction >= 70) in the evaluation of CR-70 and CR-100 at Week 4. For Week 6 and Week 8 descriptive statistics performed only for non-responders at Week 4 in the three treatment groups: adalimumab 160/80 mg + 40/40 mg, adalimumab 80/40 mg + 40/40 mg, and placebo + 160/80 mg.

outcome.title: Clinical Remission (CDAI <150) at Week 6 and Week 8
outcome.description: The number of subjects with clinical remission (CDAI < 150) in the subjects who were non-responders at Week 4 calculated with non-responder imputation (NRI) at Week 6 and Week 8
outcome.population: Subjects who were rated as non-responders (CDAI reduction < 70) in the evaluation of clinical remission (CDAI<150) at Week 4. For Week 6 and Week 8 descriptive statistics performed only for non-responders at Week 4 in the three treatment groups: adalimumab 160/80 mg + 40/40 mg, adalimumab 80/40 mg + 40/40 mg, and placebo + adalimumab 160/80 mg.

measure.population: Subjects who were rated as non-responders (CDAI reduction < 70) in the evaluation of clinical remission (CDAI<150) at Week 4. For Week 6 and Week 8 descriptive statistics performed only for non-responders at Week 4 in the three treatment groups: adalimumab 160/80 mg + 40/40 mg, adalimumab 80/40 mg + 40/40 mg, and placebo + adalimumab 160/80 mg.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Disclosure agreements vary; most restrictive agreement states Medical Institution shall not disclose materials/information disclosed by Abbott Japan in connection with the Clinical Research, or information obtained by conducting the Clinical Research, to third parties without Abbott Japans prior written approval. When Medical Institution intends to publish information obtained by conducting the Clinical Research, Medical Institution shall obtain Abbott Japans prior written approval.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Small population, therefore no statistical tests were performed
